content:
Marty is trying to choose a cable TV package.  He has several different options that are priced differently based on the number of channels that he buys.  He's used the line $y = 0.25x + 15$ to model the monthly price in dollars as a function of the number of channels in the TV package.

**In the table below, calculate the residual value for each point.  Then plot the residuals on the graph below.**   

**Which of the following changes would improve the fit of the model?** 

[[☃ radio 1]]

 | | | || | |
- | - | -
**Channels** | $20$| $40$ | $60$ | $80$|$100$|$120$ 
**Price ($\$$)** | $16$ | $19$| $25.5$ | $29.5$| $34$|$40.5$|  
**Residual value** | [[☃ input-number 1]] | [[☃ input-number 2]]|  [[☃ input-number 3]]| [[☃ input-number 4]]|[[☃ input-number 5]]|[[☃ input-number 6]]
  

[[☃ interactive-graph 1]]

choices.content: Increase the slope of the line.
Decrease the slope of the line.
Increase the y-intercept of the line.
Decrease the y-intercept of the line.
None of the above - the model is a good fit for the data.
